誤.definition: mistake; error; to miss; to harm; to delay; to neglect; mistakenly

誤上賊船.definition: lit. to mistakenly board a pirate ship; to embark on a hopeless adventure

誤事.definition: to hold things up; to make a botch of things

誤人子弟.definition: (of a lazy or incompetent teacher) to hamper students' progress; (of media) to propagate errors; to lead people astray

誤作.definition: to consider erroneously; incorrectly attributed to sb

誤信.definition: to falsely believe; to be mislead; to fall for (a trick etc)

誤入歧途.definition: to take a wrong step in life (idiom); to go astray

誤判.definition: to misjudge; error of judgment; incorrect ruling; miscarriage of justice

誤區.definition: mistaken ideas; misconceptions; the error of one's ways

誤寫.definition: to unwittingly write the wrong thing

誤工.definition: to be late for or absent from work; to disrupt one's work; to cause a holdup in the work; loss of working time; a holdup

誤會.definition: to misunderstand; to mistake; misunderstanding; CL:個|个[ge4]

誤植.definition: to write a word incorrectly; typo; (medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)

誤繕.definition: to miswrite (while copying written material); to transcribe incorrectly; to make a clerical error

誤置.definition: to put sth in the wrong place

誤診.definition: to misdiagnose; to be late in giving medical treatment

誤讀.definition: to misread; (fig.) to misunderstand; to misinterpret

誤食.definition: to accidentally eat; to inadvertently ingest

誤點.definition: not on time; late (public transport, airlines); overdue; behind schedule; delayed
